fields.title: Interstellar
fields.review: Interstellar is not only a grand space adventure worthy of the big screen, it's also a powerfully emotional story about the bond between a father and daughter, and how that love can drive one to attempt the impossible.

fields.title: The Prestige
fields.review: Just when viewers think they've figured things out, that's when the exquisite diversionary tactics really kick in.

fields.title: Batman: The Dark Knight
fields.review: A masterpiece within or outside the superhero & comic book genre it explores. Heath Ledger delivers one of the most iconic performances in film history.

fields.title: The Devil All The Time
fields.review: The Devil All the Time is soaked in blood and dirt, holy water and tears, and there's not a lot of it that will wash away.

fields.title: Memento
fields.review: Memento takes us on a mental trip of recovery, revenge, and remembering.

fields.title: The Godfather
fields.review: An engrossing metaphor for American capitalism, watching the film on the big screen emphasises the majesty of Coppolas work.

fields.title: Avengers: Infinity War
fields.review: Infinity War is all about balance, in many different respects. Balance and tone, both of which, for a film with such ambition and size, are remarkable in how well they are executed. It is worth 10 years of waiting.

fields.title: Moonknight
fields.review: After such a fun season that deftly mixed superhero heroics with genuine psychological depth, we cant wait to see whatever the characters do next. Its hard not to be over the moon.

fields.title: Forrest Gump
fields.review: Contrasting Forrest's unassuming innocence with the upheavals and rancor of the times, the film is a wisely goofy commentary on the stupidity of smartness.

fields.title: Arrival
fields.review: Both cerebral and achingly emotional, Arrival sustains a message about hope and understanding for a better humanity that audiences may need right now.
